intro: Manulea karrooica, commonly known as the Karoo manulea, is a shrub native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access groundwater. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
